quotes: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much; it is whether we provide enough for those who have too little.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: This is preeminently the time to speak the truth, the whole truth, frankly and boldly.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Only a foolish optimist can deny the dark realities of the moment.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: In these days of difficulty, we Americans must and shall choose the path of social justiceâ€¦ the path of faith, the path of hope and the path of love toward our fellow man.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Human kindness has never weakened the stamina or softened the fiber of a free people. A nation does not have to be cruel to be tough.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: I see one-third of a nation ill-housed, ill-clad, ill-nourished.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Happiness lies not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Men and nature must work hand in hand. The throwing out of balance of the resources of nature throws out of balance also the lives of men.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Among American citizens, there should be no forgotten men and no forgotten races.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: This generation of Americans has a rendezvous with destiny.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: We must be the great arsenal of democracy.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: We have always known that heedless self-interest was bad morals; we know now that it is bad economics.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Freedom of speech...Freedom of worship...Freedom from want...Freedom from fear.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the assessment that something else is more important than fear.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Democracy cannot succeed unless those who express their choice are prepared to choose wisely. The real safeguard of democracy, therefore, is education.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: More than an end to war, we want an end to the beginnings of all wars.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: I ask you to judge me by the enemies I have made.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Calm seas never made a good sailor.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: When you get to the end of your rope. Tie a knot and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Great power involves great responsibility.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Above all, try something.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Presidents are selected, not elected.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes: Never underestimate a man who overestimates himself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
